anyone know of a good cd ripping app?: grip is a nice graphical front end
sound juicer should already be on your system though
grip + lame is a nicer combo anyway :)
is glame same as that lame program u were speaking of to use with grip?
afaik, glame is a sort of audio editor package, like audacity on steroids
you set that in the "encode" file format under the config->encode tab
put something like this in the config -> encode tab: ~/temp/%A - %d (%y)/%t - %n.%x
if you want them to be encoded in ~/temp for example
that will put your raw rips (not encoded) to ~/mp3/Artistname/Albumname and create those directories
you can read about the weird looking configuration switches in the grip help
it's simple actually. just remember as thoreauputic said, you have separate places for riped and encoded files. you have an option to delete the unencoded files after they've been encoded
.ogg is basically an open source version of .mp3
that's one of the primary benefits of linux - eventually you actually understand what it's doing
thats a very good point i have caught myself actually understanding errors it gives me and being able to fix them based on the computers response
one of the things that drives me crazy about Windows - I don't know what it's doing and there's no way to find out (apart from reverse engineering, but that's beyond my abilities)
